info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 5 at 2:29PM CDT until July 6 at 4:36AM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
Guadalupe River At NB Abv Comal affecting Comal and Guadalupe Counties.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Guadalupe River at NB Abv Comal.
* WHEN...Until late tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Moderate lowland floodng closes several sections of River Road. Campers autos and equipment along the river can be washed downstream.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:15 PM CDT Saturday was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.2 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.8 feet on 05/05/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight by 445 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT
